presets.resolution.title: Resolution
presets.resolution.help.0: Choose an output resolution from these presets.
presets.resolution.help.1: Your selection will also be used for startup. 1280x960 is recommended for NTSC sources, 1280x1024 for PAL.
presets.resolution.help.2: Use the "Matched Presets" option to switch between the two automatically (Preferences tab)
presets.presets.title: Presets
presets.presets.help.0: If you want to save your customizations, first select a slot for your new preset, then save to or load from that slot.
presets.presets.help.1: Selecting a slot also makes it the new startup preset.
control.adcGain.help.0: Gain +/- adjusts the gain for the currently loaded preset.
filters.title: Filters
filters.help.0: Scanlines only work with 240p sources. They look best with the Line Filter enabled.
filters.help.1: Peaking and Step Response are subtle sharpening filters and recommended.
preferences.title: Settings
preferences.matchedPresets.help.0: If enabled, default to 1280x960 for NTSC 60 and 1280x1024 for PAL 50 (does not apply for 720p / 1080p presets).
preferences.fullHeight.help.0: Some presets default to not using the entire vertical output resolution, leaving some lines black.
preferences.fullHeight.help.1: With Full Height enabled, these presets will instead scale to fill more of the screen height.
preferences.lowResUpscaling.help.0: Low Resolution VGA input: Pass-through or Upscale
preferences.lowResUpscaling.help.1: Low resolution sources can be either passed on directly or get upscaled.
preferences.lowResUpscaling.help.2: Upscaling may have some border / scaling issues, but is more compatible with displays.
preferences.lowResUpscaling.help.3: Also, refresh rates other than 60Hz are not well supported yet.
preferences.lowResUpscaling.help.4: "Low resolution" is currently set at below or equal to 640x480 (525 active lines).
preferences.rgbhvComponentToggle.help.0: The default output mode is RGBHV, suitable for use with VGA cables or HDMI converters.
preferences.rgbhvComponentToggle.help.1: An experimental YPbPr mode can also be selected. Compatibility is still spotty.
preferences.outputRateForcePal60: Output Frame Rate: Force PAL 50Hz to 60Hz
preferences.outputRateForcePal60.help.0: If your TV does not support 50Hz sources (displaying unknown format, no matter the preset), try this option.
preferences.outputRateForcePal60.help.1: The frame rate will not be as smooth. Reboot required.
preferences.adcCalibration.help.0: Gbscontrol calibrates the ADC offsets on startup.
preferences.adcCalibration.help.1: In case of color shift problems, try disabling this function.
preferences.activeFrameTimeLock.help.0: Two methods are available. Try switching methods if your display goes blank.
preferences.deinterlaceMethod.help.0: Gbscontrol detects interlaced content and automatically toggles deinterlacing.
preferences.deinterlaceMethod.help.1: Bob Method: essentially no deinterlacing, no added lag but flickers
preferences.deinterlaceMethod.help.2: Motion Adaptive: removes flicker, adds 1 frame of lag and shows some artefacts in moving details
preferences.deinterlaceMethod.help.3: If possible, configure the source for progressive output. Otherwise, using Motion Adaptive is recommended.
preferences.developerMode.help.0: Enables the developer menu which contains various debugging tools
preferences.customSlotFilters.help.0: When enabled, saved slots recover it owns filter preferences.
preferences.customSlotFilters.help.1: When disabled, saved slots maintain current filter settings.
developer.title: Developer
system.title: System
system.backup.title: Backup [intended for same device]
system.backup.help.1: Backup is valid for current device only
system.wifi.title: Wi-Fi
prompt.title: Prompt
alert.title: ALERT
output.title: Output
